members.name: Yousef Bulbulia
members.message: Yousef is a fourth year student double majoring in math and CS. As the executive director, he helps create and support initiatives that help students grow themselves academically and professionally. When he's not busy, you can find him playing guitar, hanging out on UTM discord servers, or dying in Apex Legends.

members.name: VyVy Ngo
members.message: As the vice-executive director, VyVy wants to create a welcoming computer science environment by providing students access to any information they need. She has a passion learning and grabs any information within her reach. In her spare time, she enjoys book illumination and playing Skyrim.

members.name: Lance Tugade
members.message: Lance is a third-year student majoring in Computer Science and minoring in both Math and Education Studies. In his free time you can find him coding useful scripts, exploring different cuisines and singing. I am also very interested in education and how we learn. I am always excited to learn about new ways we can learn CS better

members.name: Kiara Callender
members.message: Third Year student at UTM studying Computer Science and Criminology with a minor in political science. She enjoys anything anime and gaming related and she loves dogs!

members.name: Manjoy Malhotra
members.message: Joy is a fifth year student double majoring in Computer Science and Professional Writing. She loves learning new tech, getting to explore different perspectives and learning about new culture‚Äôs, and teaching. She hopes to run initiatives that support students‚Äô academic and career growth, and creating opportunities for students in the CS community!

members.name: Michael Liut
members.message: Michael is a Computer Science educator who prides himself in fostering an environment of educational excellence through active and experiential learning. In recent years he has assisted in the development and implementation of active learning materials/strategies in several Computer Science courses at UTM. Michael enjoys travelling, and is an avid scuba diver.

members.name: Riya Shah
members.message: Riya Shah is a third year UofT student majoring in Geographical Information Systems (GIS), minoring in Biology and Biomedical communications. She‚Äôs a natural collaborator, always eager to work with others to find innovative solutions to challenging problems. She loves watching netflix, hiking and painting aside from working on a variety of projects.

members.name: Devishi Ranjan
members.message: Devishi is a fourth year majoring in computer science and CCIT who favors front-end web development. She's frequently busy creating new theme designs, but when she's not coding, you can find her working on illustrations or writing creative fiction.

members.name: Le Nguyen
members.message: Le is a second year statistics major with a double minor in math and computer science. She is interested in data analytics and data science. In her free time, she enjoys listening to music and watching youtube videos.

members.name: Kevin Ni
members.message: Kevin is a second year specializing in computer science and majoring in statistics. His primary interests are in machine learning and data science. You might find him procrastinating by attending other people's lectures or watching YouTube in an empty classroom.

members.name: Joshua Spencer
members.message: Joshua is a double Major in Computer Science and Commerce and hopes to engage with the CS community and create an impact.

members.name: Emma Teng
members.message: Emma is a second-year CS and Stats major. She enjoys small projects and badminton. She also likes to rest but you can often spot her in the library struggling over stats and pulling all-nighters.

members.name: Giang Bui
members.message: Second year student studying Computer Science and Management, with a passion for software development. Giang loves learning and experimenting with new technologies. In her free time, Giang enjoys cooking (and eating, so feel free to DM her for food tour :D), knitting and reading (her favorite genre is detective fiction).

members.name: Brian Zhang
members.message: Brian is a third year majoring in computer science and CCIT with a keen interest in front-end development. He enjoys high-level software development as a whole but otherwise you can find him in one of UTM's many student communities or watching YouTube videos and playing various video games!

members.name: Sukhman Vig
members.message: Sukhman Vig is a fourth year student at UofT studying Computer Science, Statistics and Communication Culture Information Technology. She is someone who is passionate about using technology, data analysis, and communication to solve complex problems, create new products and services, and bring people together in innovative ways.

members.name: Manav Bhojak
members.message: Manav is a 4th year computer science major interested in backend development. He enjoys coding, playing video games, and going out with friends.

members.name: Jessica Anderson
members.message: Jessica was accepted into UTM as an Accounting Student, but ended up wanting to do Computer Science, so she is ready to tackle any of your POSt questions. She always struggles to choose which courses are most important to take and she's ready to share her findings!

members.name: Nameera Azim
members.message: Nameera is a third-year student specializing in Computer Science and minoring in both Statistics and Business. On lazy days, you can probably find her reading, painting, fangirling over an MCU movie, watching the Premier League, or messing around with her ukulele! Feel free to reach out!

members.name: Naaz Sibia
members.message: Naaz likes preference learning and Human-Computer Interaction (with a CS-ed focus). She also likes talking about mental health, and courses she's TA'ed. When not looking into the mentioned topics, or working to finish her bachelor's degree, she likes having 3 am discussions with friends, drawing chibis, and eating Chinese food.

members.name: Ritvik Bhardwaj
members.message: Ritvik is a CS specialist with a hunger to learn new and exciting technologies. He loves learning about new things related to computer science :D

members.name: Isha Kerpal
members.message: Isha enjoys handling the social media accounts for CSSC, helping plan our promotion strategies, and responding to the questions we get on our platforms from students. She enjoys overseeing the planning of events and making sure the process is smooth for the entire CSSC team.

members.name: Leila Uy
members.message: In her free time, she enjoys going to unique food places with her friends. Whether it's taiyaki ice cream or 24-inch sliced pizza, she knows a place you can go together and she'll try anything at least once.

members.name: Hayden Mak
members.message: Hayden is a CS Specialist who really enjoys photography. You can find him around campus photographing events, listening to music, or at the RAWC table tennis room!

members.name: Sukhman Vig
members.message: Sukhman is studying Computer Science, Statistics and CCIT at UofT. She found her passion for supporting students while working as a Leadership and Mentorship Assistant at the Centre for Student Engagement. She enjoys conversations about student life, finding success as a woman in tech and mental health strategies.

members.message: Second Year student at UTM studying Computer Science and Criminology. She enjoys anything anime and gaming related and she loves dogs!

members.name: Elysia Monde Zhi Yong
members.message: Elysia is a CS Specialist and an avid drinker of pure black coffee. Why? For the energy to grind both CS projects, and digital drawings of course. Mostly the latter though.

members.message: Andriy is a third year Computer Science Specialist with an interest in web development. Andriy likes to learn and work with bleeding-edge technology.

members.message: Nitya is currently a part of the Business/Economics department. She enjoys connecting with people outside of her program and learning and contributing to the CS department. Being involved in the operations team provided her insight into the team and its goals in general. Whether you are a CS student or not feel free to connect if you would like to know more about our events!

members.name: Akira Takaki
members.message: Akira is learning math and cs in university, but while he isn't beepboop-ing or looking at arcane runes, he loves to play strategy games with friends like Settlers of Catan or Age of Empires 3. He's a big foodie, having grown up in Toronto and been exposed to the multicultural mosaic!

members.message: Yousef is a third year student double majoring in math and CS and minoring in statistics. As a technology officer, he's always up to helping out students with any technical questions they may have! When he's not busy, you can find him playing guitar, hanging out on UTM discord servers, or dying in Apex Legends.

members.name: Maryam Gohargani
members.message: Maryam is passionate about algorithms, low-level programming, and compilers. In her spare time, she hangs out on UTM's Discord communities and plays Legend of Zelda: BotW. Feel free to reach out to her for academic support or to give recommendations for ramen places in Toronto.

members.name: Alexandra Thompson
members.message: Alexandra found her passion for working with students in her time as an undergraduate Computer Science teaching assistant. She enjoys conversations on the ups and downs of student life and her experience as an undergraduate. Alexandra loves to share her tips on overcoming struggles in university.

members.name: Chris Lim
members.message: Chris is our tech lead! He recently finished a CSC492 project where he created a tinder-like application for students to match with school clubs! If you need help with your personal projects or want to learn a new technology, he's your go to man!

members.name: Jessica Anderson
members.message: Jessica was accepted into UTM as an Accounting Student, but ended up wanting to do Computer Science, so she is ready to tackle any of your POSt questions. She always struggles to choose which courses are most important to take and she's ready to share her findings!

members.name: VyVy Ngo
members.message: As the student resource curator, VyVy wants to create a welcoming computer science environment by providing students access to any information they need. She has a passion learning and grabs any information within her reach. In her spare time, she enjoys knitting and some Skyrim.

members.name: Nameera Azim
members.message: Nameera dedicates her time to connecting with the students within the Computer Science community to learn about what type of support they need and advocating for changes that improve their University experience. Feel free to shoot her message if you want to talk about anything - from internships to Earnest Hemmingway to new Marvel movies.

members.name: Coco Liang
members.message: Coco is passionate about writing as well as computer science, notably writing about computer science. She likes using words to help bridge communication between students, staff, and the entire community. In her spare time, Coco likes to play RPGs with heavy emphasis on atmosphere.

members.name: Hayden Mak
members.message: Hayden is a CS Specialist who enjoys everything photography. You can find him around campus taking pictures at different events.

members.name: Milind Vishnoi
members.message: Milind is one of the core developers of the UTM CSSC website. He is well versed in different technologies and would love to collaborate on any interesting projects. He enjoys playing 2k, travelling, and is a car & fitness enthusiast.

members.name: Benson Su
members.message: Benson is a hard worker, always willing to help you tackle any task you might be stuck on. Otherwise, Benson spends way too much time making Discord emojis from cute animals, and he once disguised himself as a pet turtle to enter a Hackathon üê¢

members.name: Zain Kazmi
members.message: Zain has co-authored multiple peer-reviewed publications in CS Education, HCI and Machine Learning. In 2021, he started working as a consultant to the Government of Ontario on transportation security initiatives. He is also part of an international working group focusing on mapping industry clouds skills to higher-education curriculums.
